[Home](./index.md) &gt; [blockly](./blockly.md) &gt; [Events](./blockly.events.md) &gt; [BlockMove](./blockly.events.blockmove.md)

## Events.BlockMove class

Notifies listeners when a block is moved. This could be from one connection to another, or from one location on the workspace to another.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class BlockMove extends BlockBase 
```
**Extends:** [BlockBase](./blockly.events.blockbase.md)

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)(opt\_block)](./blockly.events.blockmove._constructor_.md) |  | Constructs a new instance of the <code>BlockMove</code> class |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [newCoordinate?](./blockly.events.blockmove.newcoordinate.md) |  | [Coordinate](./blockly.utils.coordinate.md) | _(Optional)_ The new X and Y workspace coordinates of the block if it is a top-level block. Undefined if it is not a top level block. |
|  [newInputName?](./blockly.events.blockmove.newinputname.md) |  | string | _(Optional)_ The name of the new input. Undefined if it is a top-level block or the parent's next block. |
|  [newParentId?](./blockly.events.blockmove.newparentid.md) |  | string | _(Optional)_ The ID of the new parent block. Undefined if it is a top-level block. |
|  [oldCoordinate?](./blockly.events.blockmove.oldcoordinate.md) |  | [Coordinate](./blockly.utils.coordinate.md) | _(Optional)_ The old X and Y workspace coordinates of the block if it was a top level block. Undefined if it was not a top level block. |
|  [oldInputName?](./blockly.events.blockmove.oldinputname.md) |  | string | _(Optional)_ The name of the old input. Undefined if it was a top-level block or the parent's next block. |
|  [oldParentId?](./blockly.events.blockmove.oldparentid.md) |  | string | _(Optional)_ The ID of the old parent block. Undefined if it was a top-level block. |
|  [reason?](./blockly.events.blockmove.reason.md) |  | string\[\] | _(Optional)_ An explanation of what this move is for. Known values include: 'drag' -- A drag operation completed. 'bump' -- Block got bumped away from an invalid connection. 'snap' -- Block got shifted to line up with the grid. 'inbounds' -- Block got pushed back into a non-scrolling workspace. 'connect' -- Block got connected to another block. 'disconnect' -- Block got disconnected from another block. 'create' -- Block created via XML. 'cleanup' -- Workspace aligned top-level blocks. Event merging may create multiple reasons: \['drag', 'bump', 'snap'\]. |
|  [type](./blockly.events.blockmove.type.md) |  | EventType |  |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [isNull()](./blockly.events.blockmove.isnull.md) |  | Does this event record any change of state? |
|  [recordNew()](./blockly.events.blockmove.recordnew.md) |  | Record the block's new location. Called after the move. |
|  [run(forward)](./blockly.events.blockmove.run.md) |  | Run a move event. |
|  [setReason(reason)](./blockly.events.blockmove.setreason.md) |  | Set the reason for a move event. |
|  [toJson()](./blockly.events.blockmove.tojson.md) |  | Encode the event as JSON. |
